intro: Doxantha, commonly known as the false dandelion, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It consists of several species that are native to various regions of Africa, South America, and Australia. The plants typically have basal leaves that are either linear or lance-shaped, and they produce small, yellowish flowers arranged in a composite head. Doxantha species are often found in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. They are sometimes used in horticulture for their ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
